1453333331222.content:
They stood infront of the gate and reached around in their bags getting their passports and boarding passes ready when Bernadette realized she had no idea where her passport had gone. Her stomach sunk (which coinscidentally had her momentarily worried for reasons other than the missing passport) and she scanned around the area seeing if she'd dropped it near by. Penny and Amy stared at her wide eyed and just as worried.

Before they managed to panic too much, a tall, curvy woman looking only a few years older than them approached with an air of confidence and two passports in hand.
"Excuse me but does this belong to you?" the stranger asked Bernadette. The three breathed a sigh of relief and thanked this woman profusely. "Darlings, don't worry! Just be more careful next time!". As condesending as this was, the trio couldn't deny that this stranger had saved their trip.
Further conversation with the stranger revealed her to be Victoria, a business woman from New York who was on her way home after a meeting. As mentioned earlier, she was tall and curvey yet she carried a certain elegance and maturity to her. She had chesnut hair and a soft, warm voice. It just so happened that Victoria had been assigned the seat next to the girls on the plane.
"It's great we're sat next to another adult, Victoria. Not some kid who will spend the entire flight crying and being a general pain" Penny joked. Victoria who had been fairly chatty up to this point simply smiled at this as if she knew something Penny didn't. That bugged her.
Infact the situation in general bugged Penny to some extent. Victoria acted strange. She was incredibly condesending. Almost motherly towards Penny and her friends. Penny felt like the leader of the group and as nice as Victoria was, Penny did not appreciate having Victoria here treating them like a bunch of toddlers just because Bernadette was careless. Despite this, the other two girls hadn't seemed bugged. Still... Penny wasn't entirely happy.

They boarded the plane without any other hassle and took their seats.

What happened next?
1453333331222.title: Bernadette can't find her passport

14533333312221.content:
Victoria boarded the plane with the girls and found their seats. Victoria had the window seat with Penny sitting next to her, Penny was seated next to Penny, and Bernadette had the aisle seat. Penny was uneasy about sitting next to the woman with how condescending she had been, but didn't want to switch her seat giving the impression she was afraid of sitting next to a stranger. After they got settled Victoria began to speak.

Victoria: "Such a shame airlines stopped giving away those free bags of nuts. I've started carrying my own snacks with me. Would any of you like a snack?"

"What's got you headed to New York?"
"My girlfriend's there." He told her.
"Judging by your accent.", Victoria told him, "You're from the South."

1453333331223.content:
It was a peculiar sight. The girl was in a quiet corner of the waiting terminal. There were a few people around but they were all obviously not interested. Led by Amy, the trio aproached the child. She had black hair in pigtails and wore a yellow summer dress. Her back was turned but the girls could tell she had her head in her hands.
"Hey there sweetie. What's wrong?" Amy asked with concern as she reached forward and put a hand on the childs shoulder. The kid suddenly spun around as fast as light lowering her hands to reveal dust of some sort and blew it straight in the faces of Amy, Penny and Bernadette. Amy took the brunt of the dust but they all got their fair share.

They coughed and splutering shouting protest but when their vision cleared, the girl was gone. The previously uninterested few people sat around were suddenly interested again and looked on with strange stares at the commotion. Embarrassed, the girls hurried on towards their gate ready to board the plane. They were left shocked and confused but didn't let some silly kid playing a prank phase them.


Just then...
1453333331223.title: Amy spots a crying young girl

14533333312231.content: The trio wiped off their faces and dusted off their shirts and continued on their way to the gate, but when they got there the guard stopped them and refused to let them board. All three girls asked at the same time why, but what was the reason the guard gave them?
14533333312231.title: They were stopped at the gate before boarding t...

145333333122311.content:
"Well hello their, cuties! Where are your parents?" asked the lady on the desk of the gate.
The trio looked at each other, then they looked around, then at each other again. Finally they stared blankly at the lady asking the question in shocked silence. She reached for radio and spoke into it "I have three little girls here at gate 13 trying to board a plane to New York... has anyone heard anything about this?" she asked with genuine confusion.
"What are you talking about? We are adults!" Berndatte spoke with poison. How dare she call her and her friends children. She'd grown up having people make jokes about her height... Calling her a baby girl and such simply because she was short. She wouldn't stand f- Bernadettes thought was halted when a large man took her hand and led her and her friends away from the gate. They were taken to an office much to their protest. Penny being the toughest of the girls tried to pull away from the man holding her hand but he simply chuckled and told her it would be alright and he just needed to find her parents...? She was completely lost for words. In the office a bored looking woman sat at a desk. She must've been early 20's and she sat up suddenly sat up upon entrance of one of the men to bring the girls into her office.
"We will find your parents said one of the men that had brought them in, this is Tracey. She will look after you for now." he said cooly. He then gave "Tracey" a wink and she giggled. The girls each took a seat in the office, each red with anger. Well... two of them were. Amy suddenly broke down into tears which only added to Penny and Bernadettes confusion and even a bit of annoyance at her for conforming with these lunatics and their baby treatment.

It was then revealed why Amy was crying...
145333333122311.title: They weren't with their mommy

info.description:
MAKE THE CHAPTERS AS LONG AS POSSIBLE! THANK YOU!

Now you can put any girl back into diapers, it could be Penny, Bernadette or Amy or any other girl of your choosing

Mental Regression, accidents, forces, sexual content and others you can think of you can do

So have fun!
